Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course is good for walking through the textbook. You will learn most of the verb connjugation forms and lots of vocabulary.
Being able to speak more fluidly.

The way Professor Reymundi structured her class really helped me improve my Spanish. I struggled a lot more in Spanish last semester but not that much this semester. This class helped me figure out ways to better my study methodswhat I found specifically helpful was the practice test that she would give us before each exam.
I learned how to better string sentences together and Spanish and a variety of tenses.
I learned how to read, write, and speak Spanish well.
I learned more Spanish grammar and was able to expand my vocabulary considerably.
Advanced my Spanish
Spanish

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: More weaknesses than strengths. If you're looking for a "high school" type of language learning experience, then this is the one for you -- most classes we get a worksheet, fill it out, then go over the answers all together. No movement around the class, no shuffling of seats, so you don't really get to know other people in the class. Sometimes there was textbook work - read the passage and answer the multiple choice questions, which I hated. Sometimes for class work, I thought "what the heck is this" with a disappointed face. When it seems the professor didn't put in much effort into developing interactive and varied lesson plans, the class is dull.
I thought it was great to be able to speak with native speakers every week. There was a lot of busy work, but I guess that is necessary to learn a language.

Professor Reymundi was very understanding and she is also very communicable to her students. Her feedback on compositions, exams, assignments, etc. were very helpful. I think a weakness would be the lack of guidance on the last two class projects. The difference from her class and the other Spanish class I took last semester was that my other professor made sure that we started our projects early and guided us as to what she expected out of it. Professor Reymundi just gave us a rubric without very clear instructions as to what she expects from the projects.

A strength is the sturcture. We knew what was coming next and everything is clearly outlined in the syllabus with minimal changes. A weakness is the pace in which the course goes. We only have a semester and it is a lot of content to learn and retain rather than just regurgitate for tests.
A strength of this course is that it really is full immersion and the teachers are very invested in your growth. We have many assignments during the week that help us enhance our abilities.

Stregnth: Prof Reymundi is extremely kind, understanding and engaged with the course.

Weaknesses: I felt lost when we needed to learn the material through Supersite before actually learning the grammar in class.
Fast grading and good testing of my knowledge
Everything is a strength except for Linguameeting, that is horrible.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: No, choose a different professor.
Yeah, i thought the class was really well organized although there was a lot of work

I would recommend taking this course to another student, especially if you are really passionate about learning another language. In general, the language department at Yale is known to be very rigorous and I think that the Spanish department is one of the most rigorous at Yale. It is very challenging but if you are someone who really wants to learn the language, I recommend that you take this class because it would really force you to learn the language.
I recommend this course if you truly want to learn Spanish. You will definitely come out knowing a lot of tenses, grammar, and vocab.
I would recommend this course for anyone looking to learn Spanish. The class is really designed for you to succeed, so if you put in the work to learn vocabulary and study, you will do well.
I would recommend it to anybody who is a beginner and wants to improve their Spanish. However, the pace is fast and there is a lot of wrok.
Yes because it is good to better your Spanish
